newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: KEPCO issues July fuel oil import tender.
newsitem.headline: KEPCO issues July fuel oil import tender.

text.p: The Korean Electric Power Company (KEPCO) has issued a tender to buy two 70,000-tonne, 540-centistoke fuel oil for July delivery, a KEPCO source said on Thursday.
The tender, which seeks to buy 0.3 percent fuel oil, will close on May 16 and is valid for three days.
The two cargoes are for delivery July 8-12 and 27-31 to Ulsan, the source said.
In its last fuel oil purchase, KEPCO awarded its term tender to buy 748,000 tonnes of 0.3-percent fuel oil for February to June delivery to Ulsan Yukong and Hanwha.

Half of the fuel oil was bought at $45.90 per tonne premium to Singapore spot 180-cst quotes on a delivered and duty paid basis and the rest was bought at $34.95 per tonne over Singapore spot 180-cst quotes on a cost-and-freight basis.
